En estos momentos lo que desea Asdrubal es solicitar un préstamo por ¢300,000 (trescientos mil colones) para comprar cerdos y alimento, que necesita para su proyecto de porcicultura. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida.  
Asdrubal forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socio ha recibido un microcrédito que le han permitido crecer como microempresarios.
texts.en:
Asdrubal, aged 37, is a young man living with his family in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón, located 150 kilometers south of San José, the capital of Costa Rica. It is elevated 850 meters above sea level. Local crops are vegetables and coffee, and other activities like cattle fattening and pig rearing have developed. There are also a few projects of organic farming and vegetable hydroponics. In addition to agriculture, the community has vehicle repair shops, a supermarket, small restaurants (coffee bars) and a furniture store.

Asdrubal has been working for some time in his pigsty and so far he has 10 pigs. He began this activity five years ago and has got good results since the beginning, because his business has been widely accepted in his community and the earnings from it have enabled him to bring up his family.

Right now Asdrubal wants to apply for a loan of 300,000 colones to buy pigs and feed for his pigsty. He expects that this loan will help his microbusiness grow and generate more income to improve his living conditions.

Asdrubal is a member of the Bancruce Communal Credit Company, one of the 150 partner organizations of the microfinance institution EDESA in Costa Rica. As a member he was granted a microloan that enabled him to grow as a small business owner.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Ernesto es un hombre muy trabajador, que desde hace 8 años tiene un taxi que el mismo maneja, con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo compro su propia concesión y el automóvil, para no seguir pagando renta ya que no lo permitía tener muchas ganancias solo para lo suficiente para subsistir. Ahora cómo ve que le va muy bien en su negocio y esta prosperando quiere comprar otro automóvil para ponerlo como taxi y contratar un chofer para que se encargue, de esta manera obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Ernesto is a very hardworking man who has run a taxi service for 8 years.  With much effort and hard work he managed to purchase his own car so that he wouldn’t have to keep paying to rent one, since renting a car was preventing him from earning much profit beyond what he needed to survive.  Now things are going very well in his business and it is thriving, and so Ernesto wants to purchase another car to use as a taxi and hire a driver who will be in charge of it.  This will allow Ernesto to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Diana Gabriela

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer de 45 años, se describe como una persona amigable, sociable, trabajadora y emprendedora. Diana vive con su hijo de 1 año y medio de edad en la ciudad de Ibarra que se encuentra en la provincia de Imbabura.

Diana trabaja en la confección de camisetas, es el cuarto crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de tela e hilos, debido a que necesita incrementar su producción ya que tiene un buen pedido que le permitirá generar buenos ingresos y poder mantener a su hijo y darle la vida que se merece.

Diana sueña con costruir su propia casa y crear su propia empresa de confección, para poder dar empleo a las personas que mas lo necesiten.
texts.en:
Diana, aged 45, can be described as a friendly, sociable, hard-working and enterprising woman. She lives with her 18-month-old son in Ibarra, a city in the province of Imbabura.

Diana makes shirts. This is the fourth loan she requests from the microfinance institution Fodemi and she will use it to buy fabrics and thread, because she needs to increase her production. She has a full order book that will generate a good income, enabling her to provide for her son and offer him the kind of life that he deserves.

Diana dreams of building her own house and creating her own clothing company to provide employment for people who are most in need.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread, since she needs to increase her production because she has a full order book.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo es un joven de 24 años de edad, el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada el Upala de San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. En Alajuela existen cinco parques nacionales, una reserva nacional de fauna silvestre, cinco zonas protectoras y varias reservas forestales. También en la provincia se ubica el Museo Juan Santamaría, el cual exhibe artesanías producidas localmente. Esta zona ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña.

Desde hace doce años que Hugo se dedica a la ganadería, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con el propiedad, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados. 

Actualmente Hugo está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de dos vacas. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Hugo es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Delirio, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Hugo, aged 24, is a young man living with his wife and children in a community called Upala de San Carlos in the province of Alajuela. This province has five natural parks, one wild fauna nature reserve, five protected zones and a few forest reserves. In addition, the province hosts the Juan Santamaría Museum that exhibits local traditional craftwork. The area is the main coffee and cane sugar producer of Costa Rica.

Hugo has been working for twelve years in animal breeding. Right now he owns the premises, but lacks capital to develop his business and have his community benefit from his activity.

He applies now for a microloan of 500,000 colones to buy two cows. He expects that this loan will help his business grow and improve the quality of life of himself and his family.

Hugo is a member of the Delirio Communal Credit Company, one of the 150 partner organizations of the microfinance institution EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he expects that it will help him grow both personally and economically. He wants to be an active partner in the credit organization of his community.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is an entrepreneur from Trinidad, Bohol. She is engaged in fishing. Zenaida hires workers to operate her fishing boat to catch fish. She sells the fish at her town's market. 

Zenaida is single and supports her family and nieces and nephews.

Zenaida has requested this loan to buy fishing nets, floaters, and crab nets. She hopes for her business to prosper.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, floaters, and crab nets.

loans.name: Baigane

texts.fr: Monsieur Baigane est un célibataire  âgé de 27 ans  qui vit au Sénégal. Il est maçon depuis plus de 10 ans. Aussi parallèlement   il exerce l’activité d’aviculteur  ou il capitalise une expérience d’un an. Il a choisi ses occupations par passion mais aussi dans le souci de se procurer des revenus afin de subvenir à ses besoins  personnels ainsi qu’a ceux de ses parents. Il est plutôt intéressé  par l’aspect lucratif de sa deuxième activité. Il  est sociétaire dans un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2009. Il emprunte 400 000 frs dans le souci de s’approvisionner  en poulets pour son projet avicole et en aliment de poussins. Avec son opération  il espère accroitre ses bénéfices  et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses parents.
texts.en:
Mr. Baigane is a 27-year-old unmarried man who lives in Senegal. He has been a mason for over ten years. Concurrently, he also raises poultry and capitalizes on a year of experience. He chose these occupations for the love of them but also out of concern for acquiring income to support himself, as well as his parents. He is rather interested by the lucrative aspect of his second business. 

Mr. Baigane has been an associate in one of the U-IMCEC branch offices since October 2009. He is borrowing 400,000 francs for stocking up on chickens and for his poultry and feed project. 

With his operations, he hopes to grow his profits and to improve his parents’ living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hens and feed for chicks

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Gloria Maria tiene 24 años, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general ya tiene años de experiencia en el negocio en el cual sus clientes la buscan por el servicio y la calidad de productos que le ofrece. Gloria es una emprendedora que ha luchado por tener su propio negocio y ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad de producto, ella está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de variedad de mercadería en general.
texts.en: Gloria María is 24 years old. She sells general merchandise and has several years of experience in this business. Her customers appreciate her because of the service and the high quality of her goods. Gloria is an entrepreneur who has struggled to keep her own business and provide a diversified offer to her customers. Now she applies for this loan to buy a variety of general merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of general merchandise.

loans.name: Donatila Paulina

texts.es:
Donatila tiene 43 años , es muy trabajadora y empeñosa tiene un hijo, el cual ya tiene 22 años y quien la apoya en el negocio; Donatila vive en la ciudad de ica , la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asi como también por la Laguna de Huacachina; considerada como el oasis de América; Donatila solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria debido a los pocos recursos que tenían sus padres, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesora de educación inicial; como buena peruana Donatila ama nuestra comida, pero uno de los platillos que más le gusta es el riquísimo arroz con pollo.

Donatila tiene su negocio de cochera para mototaxis, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 4 horas al día, llegando a atender hasta 10 clientes diarios; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque brinda seguridad a sus clientes ya que en la ciudad no hay muchas cocheras y las personas no tienen donde guardar sus mototaxis.

Donatila está muy alegre y agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá mejorar su cochera construyendo las paredes de cemento, con ello su cochera tendrá mayor seguridad y los clientes tendrán más confianza en dejar sus mototaxis y tendrá mayores ingresos para poder ahorrar y poder cumplir su más grande sueño:”Tener su propio Restaurant”.
texts.en:
Donatila is a hardworking, persevering 43 year old woman.  Her son is 22 years old already and helps her with the business.  Donatila lives in the city of Ica, which is characterized by a warm climate all year round and is also known for “La Laguna de Huacachina”, which is considered the oasis of America.  Donatila only completed the fifth year of secondary school as her parents had little resources.  However, she had wanted to study early childhood education and become a teacher.  As a good Peruvian, Donatila loves our food.  One of her favorite dishes is the delicious chicken with rice.

Donatila owns a garage for motor-cycle taxis.  She works at her business four hours a day; the number of customers she attends reaches up to 10 per day.  She feels her business is going well because she offers security to her customers.  There aren’t many garages in the city and people don’t have anywhere to keep their motor-cycle taxis.

Donatila is very happy and she is grateful for the Kiva loans.  Thanks to their support, she will be able to improve her garage by building cement walls.  With this improvement, her garage will have better security and her customers will feel more comfortable leaving their motor-cycle taxis.  Then, she will have higher income and be able to save and fulfill her greatest dream: “To have her own restaurant”.

loans.use: to build garage walls.

loans.name: Juana Benita

texts.es:
Juana tiene 34 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad de chincha,  ciudad conocida por su población de origen afroperuano, por sus danzas y es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, por sus hermosas playas y por la producción de nuestro producto Bandera el “Pisco”, también esta ciudad es muy conocida por su comida ya que los pobladores de esa ciudad se les conoce por la buena sazón que tienen, uno de los platos favoritos de Juana es el riquísimo arroz con pato, Juana estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres.

Juana se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa, es muy luchadora y sobre todo responsable, ella se levanta desde muy temprano para poder hacer sus quehaceres del hogar temprano y irse a trabajar, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el dia, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy constante, por la calidad de sus productos y porque brinda facilidades de pago a sus clientes.

Juana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería, en especial productos de temporada de verano, con ello mejorara su negocio ya que tendrá mas variedad de productos para ofrecer y podrá tener más ingresos para seguir ahorrando y poder cumplir su mas grande sueño:” Ser una empresaria Exitosa”.
texts.en:
Juana is 34 years old and lives in the city of Chincha.  This city is known for its Afro-Peruvian population, for its dances, and because it is the birthplace of some great Peruvian sportspeople.  It is also known for its beautiful beaches and for its production of our country's flagship product (Pisco).  It is well known for its food.  The locals are known for the good food that they make.  One of Juana's favorite dishes is delicious duck and rice.  Juana only studied up to the fifth year of her secondary education owing to the limited financial resources of her parents.

Juana's business is selling shoes and clothing.  She is a very tenacious and responsible woman.  She gets up very early in the morning to do her housework and then goes out to work.  She works around 8 hours a day and can serve up to 15 customers.  She believes that her business is doing well because she is very persevering, her products are very good quality and she provides credit facilities to her customers.

Juana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy more merchandise, especially summer products.  This will allow her to improve her business as she will have a wider variety of products to offer her customers.  She will be able to make more income, which will allow her to continue saving and achieve her biggest dream of "becoming a successful businesswoman".

loans.use: to buy merchandise (footwear and clothing)

loans.name: Mbarani

texts.en:
Mbarani is a 37-year-old man from Vihiga town, Western Kenya. He is married to Joyce and they have four children, ages 5-12 years.

Mbarani operates a motorcycle transport business in Vihiga town. He has had this business for the last ten years, making a monthly income of KES 13,900. He is a long-time client of KADET LTD. He is taking his fifth loan, which he will use to buy another motorcycle. He will use his profits to educate his children.

His dream is to sustain his family and also provide their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos tiene 35 años de edad, su actividad económica a la que dedica es la vulcanización lo cual ya tiene años de experiencia en el negocio, junto a él trabaja su hijo mayor que se encuentra a su cargo todavía. Juan Carlos es un emprendedor que  toda la vida  ha luchado por tener sus propio negocio y generar ingresos para la familia y sacarlos adelantes a todos. Juan Carlos está solicitando crédito para comprar materia prima para invertir en el  negocio y poder brindarles a sus clientes un excelente servicio.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 35. He has a tire repair business, and already has years of experience in the business. His eldest son, for whom he is still responsible,   works with him.

Juan Carlos is an entrepreneur who has struggled all his life to have his own business, to generate income for his family, and to help everyone get ahead in life. 

Juan Carlos is applying for a loan to buy raw material for his business, in order to provide his customers with excellent service.

loans.use: To buy raw material for his tire repair business.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia continua trabajando vendiendo frutas, 

nuestra socia es natural de la provincia de Sicuani, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad del Cusco, nuestra socia alterna el cuidado de sus hijos y otras responsabilidades del hogar con el comercio de frutas al por menor, ella solicita el préstamo debido a que deberá incrementar su negocio y comprar al por mayor frutas de los proveedores.
texts.en:
Felicitas continues to sell fruit for a living.

Felicitas comes from the province of Sicuani, located about 3 hours from the city of Cusco.  She manages to balance caring for her children and other household responsibilities with her fruit-selling business.  She is asking for a loan so she can increase her business and purchase fruit from wholesale suppliers.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell.

loans.name: Hilda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Hilda, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, con la intención de tener mayores ingresos en la temporada de diciembre, éstos préstamos de ayuda a tener disponibilidad económica para hacer compras periódicas de mariscos frescos, en este caso comprará mariscos, jugos, gaseosas, para diversificar su negocio.
Ella considera que sus ventas han aumentado con el nuevo inventario, ya que tiene  surtido el negocio con la ayuda del préstamo anterior.
texts.en: Hilda has decided to apply for a new loan in order to have higher income during the December season.  These loans help her to have the financial resources available to make periodic purchases of fresh seafood.  With this loan, she will buy seafood, juice, and soft drinks to diversify her business. She believes that her sales have increased with the new inventory since she stocked the business with the help of the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase seafood, juice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Gina Matilde

texts.es:
Gina es una mujer que le gusta mucho progresar no importa los sacrificios que tenga que hacer con tal de salir adelante, ya que ella nos comenta que sin sacrificio no se consigue nada, ella vive en la ciudad de Camaná, Perú, Camaná tienen unas hermosas playas ya que solo mirarlas uno se enamoraría  y les gustaría vivir allí; como el Perú es muy conocido por su exquisita gastronomía y uno de los platillos que más le gusta a Gina son los riquísimos “pallares “, cuando Gina tiene un tiempito libre lo disfruta mirando películas, debido a los pocos recursos económicos Gina solo pudo estudiar hasta el cuarto año de secundaria.; es madre de una señorita de 22 años de edad la cual es su orgullo y su razón de vivir cada día.

Gina se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad, ella trabaja alrededor de 12 horas, ya que desde muy temprano abre su bodega para poder ofrecer sus productos, puede atender hasta 40 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va muy bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de buena calidad y sobre todo por la variedad de sus productos.

Gina agradece mucho a los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio, con esta mejora podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y aumentaran sus ingresos, con ello podrá seguir ahorrando para cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hija”
texts.en:
Gina is a women who likes to advance, it does not matter the sacrifices she has to make in order to come out ahead.  She tells us that without sacrifice nothing is achieved.  She lives in the city of Camaná, Perú.  Camaná has some beautiful beaches since at first sight one falls in love and they would like to live there.  Perú is well know for its exquisite gastronomy and one of her favorite dishes are the super delicious 'pallares'.  When she has free time, she enjoys it watching movies.  Due to her limited economic resources, she was only able to study until the fourth year of high school.  She is the mother of a 22 year old lady who is her joy and her reason to live everyday.
Gina sells groceries and other necessities.  She works about 12 hours, since she opens her store very early to be able to offer her products.  She serves up to 40 customers everyday.  She believes that she is doing very well in her business because she offers high quality products and above all because of the variety of her products.
Gina is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their support she will be able to buy more groceries for her business.  With it she will be able to offer a greater variety of products to her customers and increase her income.  With the increased income she will be able to keep saving to achieve her great dream, "to give her daughter a profession."

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Mirella Yvone

texts.es:
Mirella es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 31 años de edad y vive ne la ciudad de chincha, ciudad caracterizada por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y sobre todo por su clima cálido y por la sazón de sus pobladores para la preparación de las comidas, por ello uno de los platos favoritos de Mirella es la riquísima “Carapulcra”, Mirella estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Derecho.

Mirella trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, se levanta muy temprano para comprar los insumos para la preparación de sus platillo ya que ella nos dice que cuando los ingredientes son frescos la comida sale aun mas rica, en un dia puede atender hasta 140 clientes y es que ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque su sazon es inigualable.

Mirella está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar más insumos al por mayor y con ello los productos le saldrían mucho más baratos, con esta mejora podra tener mayores ingresos y poder en algunos meses comparase un carrito sandwichero y mas adelante poder tener el dinero suficiente para cumplir su mas grande sueño: “Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Mirella is a very hard-working woman.  She is 31 years old and was born in the city of Chincha.  This city is well known for being the birthplace of many big names in Peruvian sports.  It is also known for its warm weather and the seasoning that the locals give to their food.  One of Mirella's favorite dishes is the delicious 'Carapulcra'.  Mirella studied up to the fifth year of her secondary education but she would have liked to have studied Law. 

Mirella works in her food business.  She gets up very early to buy the supplies that she needs to make her dishes.  She says that when the ingredients are fresh, the food turns out even more delicious.  In one day she can serve up to 140 customers.  She believes that her business is doing well because the flavor of her food is unbeatable.

Mirella is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy more supplies wholesale, which will make things a lot cheaper.  This improvement will make her more income and, in a few months, she will be able to buy a sandwich cart.  In the future, she will have enough money to make her biggest dream come true: "to own my own home".

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Nueva Luna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA LUNA” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Virginia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de carne, venta de faldas, carnicería, venta de carne de cordero, venta de fruta.

La señora Virginia,  indica que hace un año y medio que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de enaguas que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela) que comprará de La Paz  y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en las ferias y otros departamentos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “NUEVA LUNA” community bank are about to start their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Germán Busch regional office.  The bank has seven members and is run by a board of directors led by Virginia.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: meat sales, skirts sales, running a butcher's shop, veal sales and fruit sales.

Virginia tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for one and a half years and that she joined the institution through an invitation from a friend.  She has a business sewing traditional skirts which she has had for years.

The loan that Virginia is taking out will be used to increase her working capital.  She will buy material in La Paz, use it in her work, and then sell her end products in street markets and other departments.  This work will allow her to make income with which to support her family.  Virginia lives with her partner and has two children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Virginia replied that she likes the training sessions.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Mujeres Cumbeñas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Cumbeñas está formado por 8 mujeres luchadoras y muy trabajadoras, laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades económicas las que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, en esta parroquia hay grandes fincas ganaderas, hermosas haciendas viejas y modernas construcciones que le dan variedad al paisaje. Su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo varias actividades económicas. Mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, manteniendo también su variada y rica gastronomía. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. María Isabel, tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su mamá quien se dedica a la cría de animales, la casa en la que vive es propiedad de su mamá.

La Señorita. María Isabel trabaja hace 3 años limpiando casas y oficinas, trabaja de lunes a viernes todo el día.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermana, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de joyas y cosméticos para iniciar con la venta de estos productos.
 
Su meta es construir su casa propia. 

Los niños de la foto son hijos de dos socias.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Cumbeñas communal bank is made up of 8 tenacious and hardworking women.  The members work in different economic activities that allow them to contribute to their household income.  They live around the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca—the parish has large cattle ranches, beautiful old estates, and modern buildings that bring some variety to the landscape.  The residents of Cumbe make a living from trade, raising livestock, and farming, while many work in the city and are engaged in various economic activities there.  The people maintain their culture and traditions, along with their rich and varied cuisine.

One of the members of the group is María Isabel.  She is 34 years old, single, and lives with her mother, who makes a living raising livestock and owns the house that they live in.

For 3 years María Isabel has worked cleaning homes and offices for a living.  She works all day from Monday to Friday.

This is María Isabel’s first loan with the communal bank, which her sister invited her to join.  She is going to use the loan to purchase jewellery and cosmetics so she can begin selling those items.

Her goal is to build her own home.

The children who appear in the photo are the children of two of the members.

loans.use: to purchase jewellery and cosmetics.

loans.name: Blanca Nieves Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BLANCA NIEVES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Tomasa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejidos en variedad, venta de chicharrones, venta de golosinas, transporte público, confección de pantalones, tejido de chompas, venta de ganado, venta de perfumes, venta de billeteras, venta de pasteles.

La señora Tomasa,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de su cuñado. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejidos que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lanas) que adquirirá de la Ceja, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración comercializará en puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.

En la fotografía no aparece la señora Yhovana ya que se encontraba en consulta médica.
texts.en:
The “BLANCA NIEVES” Communal Bank will initiate its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of its Santiago II central office. It is composed of eleven members under a board of directors led by Sra. Tomasa. The businesses of the bank’s members are varied: among them we have a variety of woven goods, the sale of  chicharrónes (pork rinds), the sale of sweets, public transportation, pants making, knitted sweaters, cattle sales, perfume sales, wallet sales and pastry sales.

Sra. Tomasa notes that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution at the invitation of her brother-in-law. Currently she has a knitted goods business that she has been working at for some time.

The loan she is requesting is to expand her capital to buy wool which she will acquire wholesale from La Ceja and later knit and sell at her sales stall. This kind of work enables her to generate earnings to support her family since she lives with her partner and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she enjoys the training.

In the photo Sra. Yhovana is missing because she had to see a doctor.

loans.use: to purchase wool.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo era la compra de mercadería agregando más rubros al negocio como son plásticos, focos, carteras, para diversificar el negocio y ofrecer al cliente mayor mercadería, la intención de ella es que sus clientes puedan encontrar varias clases de productos para generar más ventas.
Ella considera que estos préstamos le han ayudado a superarse tanto ella como su familia, adquiriendo mayor experiencia y obteniendo mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maritza has decided to apply for a new loan. It was the purchase of merchandise adding more items to the business like plastics, light bulbs, and wallets to diversify the business and offer a greater merchandise to her customers. Her intention is to have her customer find several types of products in order to generate more sales.

She considers these loans to have helped her better herself and her family, acquiring more experience and obtaining greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy plastics, light bulbs, and wallets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products for her store.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German es un hombre muy trabajador y carismático, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad caracterizada por su clima cálido y por su actividad principal que es la pesca, está casado y junto a su esposa la cual es su mano derecha y quien lo apoya mucho en todo lo que el hace, el considera que ella es su mano derecha en todo, sobre todo porque estan juntos a pesar de los obstaculos que la vida le ha puesto hasta ahora y sobre todo porque esperan con ansias en tener una familia ya que hasta el momento  no tienen hijos, ambos se esforzaron y poco a poco puedieron ahorrary para poder tener el negocio en el cual trabajan actualmente.

German se dedica a su negocio de venta de abarrotes, el cual con mucho sacrifico y dedicacion mantienen y es su fuente ingreso,German trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy respetuoso con los clientes.

German agradece a los prestatarios kiva por brindarle su apoyo ya que gracias a ello el podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio y con ello mejorar su calidad de vida y sobre todo ahorrar ya que desea cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: “Tener hijos y darles lo mejor”.
texts.en:
German is a very hard-working and charismatic man, he lives in the city of Pisco which is a city characterized for its hot climate and it's primary activity which is fishing. He is married and his wife is his other half, she supports him in everything he does.  He considers her like his right hand for everything especially because they are still together despite the obstacles that life has put before them and overall as they anxiously await to start a family since at the present day they have no children. Both of them have worked really hard and they've saved little by little to open up the business they currently operate.
German works at the grocery store and through much sacrifice and dedication they maintain to this day; it is also his main source of income. German works 10 hours daily and sees about 15 customers a day.  He believes business is going well because he is very respectful to his clients.
German is very thankful of the Kiva lenders for their support, thanks to them he will be able to purchase merchandise for the store and through it also improve his quality of life, but overall he will be able to save for one of his life's greatest dreams: " to have children and offer them the best".

loans.use: To purchase merchandise ( grocery goods )

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Luchadoras”  ya que todas ellas están luchando para su progreso de cada una y también de todas juntas como grupo. Ellas se unieron al grupo con la esperanza de poder ayudar a sus familias y a sus hijos. Actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo y están muy contentas.
Irma es una de las miembros del grupo, ella nos comenta que se dedica la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, y que gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y proveerles de lo que necesitan para salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas, vinos, licores, gaseosas y demás bebidas para abastecer su local y tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “Mujeres Luchadoras” (“Fighting Women”) since all are  fighting for the progress of each other and for the group as a whole. The group came together with the hope of being able to help their families and children. Currently they are in their fourth loan cycle and they are very pleased.

Irma is one of the members of the group. She tells us that she sells drinks of all kinds and that, thanks to this work, she has been able to help her family and provide it with all that is necessary to move ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy beer, wine, liquor, sodas and other drinks in order to supply her store and to offer her customers a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, liquor, sodas and other drinks.

loans.name: Merci

texts.es: Merci tiene 39 años, es una mujer buena, amable y emprendedora, le gusta mucho estar en constante actividad y siempre trabaja mucho para brindar una mejor calidad a sus cuatro hijos. Ella vive en su casa propia en donde comparte su vida con Alcides de 49 años su pareja y padre de sus hijos. El trabajo de Merci consiste en la venta de bebidas en un pequeño pero muy surtido fuente de soda. Es así que durante el día su negocio es muy concurrido debido a la intensidad del calor que hay en la zona, y por ello sus clientes le piden bebidas refrescantes. Su negocio está ubicado dentro de su casa lugar que habilitó para atender a sus clientes, asimismo su pareja la ayuda en el negocio. Siente que le está yendo bien ya que cuando empezó hace 10 años vendía poco, pues solo se dedicaba a vender gaseosas, con el transcurrir del tiempo empezó vende otro tipo de bebidas que le permite tener mejores ganancias. Espera ampliar su negocio y de esa manera seguirá progresando. Este será el crédito número 4 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que recibirá el apoyo financiero para poder continuar con su trabajo y así mejorar su capital. Además se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en otros crédito que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará mas bebidas para continuar con su venta, además de refaccionar algunas cosas que necesita su local.
texts.en:
Merci is 39 years old.  She is a kind and enterprising woman who really enjoys being active.  She works hard in order to provide her four children with a better quality of life.  Merci lives in her own home together with her 49-year-old partner Alcides, the father of her children.  Merci's business is selling drinks from a small but very well-stocked diner.  During the day her business is very busy owing to the intensity of the heat in her area which means her customers request refreshing drinks.  Merci's business is located inside her home which she fixed up so that she could serve her customers.  Her partner helps her in the business.  Merci feels that her business is doing well because when she started out ten years ago she sold very little as she only sold soda.  Over time, she started selling other types of drinks, which allowed her to make more profits.  Merci hopes to expand her business and so continue making progress.

This will be Merci's fourth loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will receive financial support so that she can continue in her work and thereby improve her capital.  Merci pledges to once more make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loans.  She will use her 3,000 soles to buy more drinks so that she can continue making her sales.  She will also make some improvements to her sales premises.

loans.use: to buy a variety of drinks with which to stock her business, and to refurbish her sales location

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 56 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Manuel de 68 años y sus 7 queridos hijos,  de los cuales 5 ya son mayores de edad y solo dos dependen de ella para  tener una buena educación. El trabajo de Juana consiste en la venta de verduras y tubérculos, tiene un puesto en el mercado de su ciudad, pues es ahí donde vende zapallo, zanahoria, tomates, cebollas, entre otros  Es así que su puesto es muy concurrido por sus clientes, motivo por el cual la gran mayoría de su mercadería se vende durante el día. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y tiene muy buenos clientes a quienes ganó día a día con su buen trato, y sobre todo con los regalitos y ofertas que siempre les da. Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda muy grande donde pueda vender sus verduras con más comodidad. Este será el crédito número 9 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración par continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete en seguir siendo una socia puntual y cumplida como en créditos anteriores que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará más verduras, ya que desea implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Juana is 56, and a hard-working, straightforward woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Manuel, who is 68, and their seven dear children. Five of her children are already adults, and only two depend on her to have a good education. 

Juana sells vegetables and tubers, and has a stand in the city market, as this is where she sells squash, carrots, tomatoes, onions, and other produce. Her stall is much visited by her customers, so the great majority of her merchandise is sold during the day. 

She has been doing this work for two years, and has very good customers that day by day she has won with her good service, and especially with the little extras and specials that she always gives them.

In the future, she hopes to have a very large store where she can sell her vegetables more conveniently. This will be her ninth loan with MFP, so she is hoping for your cooperation so that she can continue toward her goals. Moreover, she promises to continue being a member who is on time and responsible, as she was with her previous loans.

With the amount of 1,000 soles applied for, she will buy more vegetables, because she wishes to do better business at her stand.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Tonis Alberto

texts.es:
Tonis, vive con su esposa y su hija, él es empleado no tiene un horario establecido trabaja de lunes a sábado.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar ladrillo y arena para mejorar su vivienda, solo de esa forma podrá estar en mejores condiciones su familia, con su salario piensa cubrir las cuotas de este prestamo.
El sueño de Tonis es pagar luego el préstamo y poner su propio negocio para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Tonis lives with his wife and daughter. He is employed and doesn't have a set schedule. He works from Monday to Saturday.

He needs the loan in order to buy brick and sand to improve his home. Only by this means will his family be able to have better living conditions. With his salary he plans on paying the fees of the loan.

Tonis' dream is to pay off the loan and then set up his own business in order to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy brick and sand.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem, 27 years-old, is the owner of a general store, where she sells mixed products to local people. She sells many types of products such as canned foods, sweet things, groceries, biscuits, soft drinks and other household things. 

She has been in this business since 2005. Now she has been blessed with young children who attend a local primary school. 

Mrs. Sem is taking out her first loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase merchandise that has run out of stock. For her prospects, she wants to expand her general store and improve her selling business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise that has run out of stock.

loans.name: Mabongisi Ya Nkolo Plus Group

texts.en:
Rebecca, is the manager of the Community bank named “Mabongisi ya Nkolo Plus”. It is composed of 11 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Rebecca started her business in 2000 with a capital of $150. Today, she operates a general boutique. She is 34 years-old, married and has four children whose ages are between four and ten. Three of them go to school. Rebecca has already received seven times the MFI HOPE DRC loans and fully repaid them. With the profit of about $30 earned per week, she intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of her business by buying cans, sugar, sacks of rice and beans and other store items to resell for a profit. Currently, Rebecca is happy to be part of one of Hope’s groups because her business has been reinforced through the loans she received. Her dream is to someday become a wholesaler. She sells in the western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying cans, sugar, sacks of rice and beans and other store items to resell for a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 25-year-old single lady who owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself.

Mwanasha has operated a retail shop for the past year; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of customers not paying their debts on time. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and detergents for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and detergents for resale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Ibrahim.  He is married, and has two children aged 6 and 9 years-old. In 1998, Ibrahim established his provision and soft drinks business.  Ibrahim started selling in a push-cart and now owns a shop. provisions are needed everyday by people living in his community.

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,601,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Ibrahim has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional stock of provisions. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Ibrahim plans to open another shop for his wife.  With with hard work, and the loan from ARD he shall achieve the dream, while Improving the life of his family. The competition is high but he will cope, because of the varieties of products he has in stock. He deals with all ages especially travelers as his business is located at the motor park.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who are cultivating his land for maize growing.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 41 year-old married man with six children living in Hioma, Uganda. He has been a farmer for ten years despite challenges of price fluctuation and inflation.  His family dream is to educate his children up to the university and his business dream is to buy land to grow more crops. Joseph needs the loan facility to pay workers who are cultivating his land.

loans.use: to pay workers who are cultivating his land.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is a 23 year-old married man with a child living in Hioma, Uganda.  After dropping out of school due to lack of school fees, he decided to learn on the job how to build.  His major challenge is customers not paying on time and his dream is to have a hardware shop.  Denis needs the loan facility to buy building materials.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Hamidah

texts.en: Hamidah is a 34 year-old single mother of two children living in Hioma, Uganda.  For eight years she has been selling shoes and this has helped her to support her family.  Her major challenge is high taxes and other fees and her dream is to set up a boutique in town.  Hamidah needs the loan facility to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 39 years-old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married, her husband is a driver and they have two children 8 and 13 years old.  They children are in school and live at home.

She has been selling rice and pepper.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learnt this way of selling from her mother. 
She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and pepper for her business.  Her plan is to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en: Pictured above is Princess, a secondary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. The thirty-four year old has served in the teaching profession for five years now. Princess is married to a teacher and the couple has four children who are attending primary school. Princess has requested for a loan in order to pay school fees for her children. At the end of each month, she will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is 67 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and has two children between 26 and 40 years old. For the past 27 years, she has been involved in business. Currently she sells charcoal, The biggest problem she faces is transportation, She is happy when she sells things as it enables her to ensure that there is always enough to get by.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Pictured above is Michael, a secondary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. 40-year-old Michael was born in Makeni city. A husband and a father of two children, Michael has served in the teaching profession for 17 years now. His wife is a businesswoman. One of his children is attending secondary school and the other is not of school-going age. Michael has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for himself and then use the remainder of the loan to buy building materials like sand and cement for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to pay college fees and buy materials to build a house

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 55 years old and married to Titus. They are blessed with three children.


Esther sells curios in Nairobi town. She has been in this business for the last six years and gets an income of KES 10,400 per month.


Esther has a good credit history with KADET LTD. She is applying for her third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to re-stock her curio shop. She will use the extra profit to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more curios to sell.

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en: Pictured above is Abdulrahman, a secondary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. Thirty-one-year-old Abdulrahman is a native of Makeni city. He is single and has one child who is attending primary school. Abdulrahman has been a teacher for eight years now. He has requested for a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to buy a piece of land for the future construction of a family house. Using his monthly salary, he will gradually repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Dorathy

texts.en: Dorathy lives in West Point. She is 40 years old, married and has seven children between 2 and 28 years old. For eight years now, she has been selling used clothes. She received a small amount from her husband to start her business and she learned it from her Auntie. She likes her business because it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her  business

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a fifty-six year old married man with seven children, living in Hioma, Uganda. He has been selling alcohol for twenty years.  He used to be able to buy four jerrycans in a month, but now he buys fifteen jerrycans a month.  His challenge is price fluctuation, and his dream is to expand the business to new markets. Gerald needs the loan facility to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Nyamawi

texts.en:
Nyamawi is a 50-year-old grocery store owner in Shanzu, Mombasa. He is married and has been running the grocery store successfully for the past four years. 

This is Nyamawi’s third business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more kale, tomatoes, potatoes and bananas. 

He will use the anticipated profits to start a charcoal business. He hopes to have his own permanent residential house.

loans.use: to purchase more kale, tomatoes, potatoes and bananas

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en: Bonny is a 60-year-old priest living in Hoima, Uganda. He has rental houses and has been in business for 10 years. His challenge is tenants not paying on time and his dream is to own an estate. Bonny needs the loan to renovate his rental houses.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Alfred M.

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Alfred, a secondary school teacher in Makeni. Forty-year-old Alfred is a native of Makeni city, married to a teacher, and the couple has two children attending primary school. Alfred has been a professional teacher for fourteen years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials: iron, corrugated zincs, cements, etc. for the construction of a house. Michael will repay the loan using his monthly salary.

loans.use: to buy housing materials: iron, corrugated zincs, cements, etc. for the construction of a house

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a 36-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mariakani. He is a married father of five. His shop has been in operation for the past 17 years and he is doing great.

This is Abubakar’s second business loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase cooking oil, washing powders, maize flour and rice. 

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and repay his loan. He hopes to have a successful business and family.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, washing powders, maize flour and rice

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 49 years old and is married to Theresina, a poultry farmer.  He has three children. The children are aged 23,17 and 12 years respectively. 

Augustine has been in the wholesale business for 12 years and earns a monthly income of Kshs 48,000. He has requested a loan of Kshs 30,000 that he will use to purchase more makuti brooms, and mops. 

The profit, he says, would help him buy a plot in Eldoret and build his own house rather than rent. His dream is to educate his children through the income he gets from his business.

loans.use: To purchase more makuti brooms for sale

loans.name: Nasani

texts.en: Nasani is a forty-six-year-old married man with four children living in Hoima, Uganda. He has been selling alcohol for eight years and this has facilitated him in supporting his family. He started with one million Ugandan Shillings but now he has two million as his working capital. He dreams of setting up a liquor store and educating his children up to the university level. Nasani needs the loan to buy alcohol for resale.

loans.use: to buy alcohol for resale.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Felicidad is making & peddling snacks like banana cue (deep fried bananas), suman, biko & puto (three varieties of rice cakes). She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks. 

Felicidad is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Felicidad hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 60 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for over 30 years with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer. She is applying for her third loan of 15,000 KES from the company, which she plans to use to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. The client will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her family needs. In the future, Gladys hopes to grow her business and venture into mixed farming.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a twenty-seven year-old man from Migori , in the west of Kenya. He is single but he supports his parents and siblings.

Benard operates an Internet Cafe which offers other computer services, like printing. He has been doing this for the last year and makes a monthly income of Kes 20,000.

He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD., which he will use to buy a printer. He will use profits to buy more computers for his cafe. His dream is to own one of the biggest ICT centesr in Migori town.

loans.use: To buy a printer .

loans.name: Steve Michael

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is pleased to introduce to you Steve, a secondary school teacher in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Thirty-three year-old Steve is a native of Makeni and is married to a teacher.  The couple has two children – one in primary school and the other is not of school age. Steve has been a professional teacher for three years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his child and for himself.  At the end of each month, he will repay the loan, using his monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child and for himself

loans.name: Mohamed A.

texts.en:
Forty-four-year-old Mohamed is a native of Kolisokoh village in northern Sierra Leone. A secondary school teacher in Makeni, Mohamed has been a professional teacher for five years now. He is married to a trader and the couple has four children together. One of their children is attending primary school and the others are in secondary school. 

Mohamed has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan. With the help of this loan, he will buy bags of cement for the construction of a house. Gradually, using his monthly salary, Mohamed will repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement for the construction of a house

loans.name: Shakhawan

texts.en:
Shakhawan is a 31 year old Iraqi man; he is married with two children. 

Since 2008 he has been the owner of a small shop which sells small kitchen appliances and all kinds of small items needed for the kitchen, such as pots, plastic containers, utensils and many more handy items for the household. 

Shakhawan applied for and received a loan in the amount of $3000 from Relief International Iraq, which he intends to use for the renewal of his store making sure the little business can receive a needed refresh to look a little friendlier and more appealing for his customers. 

The well-located store will surely continue to attract the locals, making the business a successful income generator for the young family.

loans.use: to renew and refresh the little kitchen supplies and small appliances store

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 63-year-old widowed woman with three children who are all grown up. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself. Agnes has operated a rope selling business for the past year. Her clients are the local people at the market. She faces the major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase more stock of ropes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ropes for resale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Jocelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Lucy has a shop that makes and sells halo-halo ice candy and snacks like rice and pancakes. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell.

Lucy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lucy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 29 years old and a business lady. She is a single mother of three children. She has been running a greengrocer business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

Jane is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes are to open a retail shop and continue with the grocery business.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Victor Fortunato

texts.es:
Victor es una persona muy trabajadora a sus 54 años de edad se considera un joven de 20 años, está casado y junto a su esposa tiene 6 hijos, cuales son ya mayores de edad, cuando tiene algún tiempo libre que son muy pocos, disfruta de sembrar plantas y cuidar de su huerta. Como buen peruano Victor ama la comida, por ello su palto favorito son los “tallarines con Carapulcra”, Victor solo estudio hasta el tercer grado de educación secundaria, ya que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos suficientes, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar Mecánica Automotriz.

Victor tiene una bodega, en la cual vende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, pero no solo se dedica a ello sino como tiene una mototaxi la alquila para tener un poco mas de ingresos y no solo eso sino en temporadas trabaja en una hacienda. Victor le dedica al negocio de su bodega alrededor de 7 horas diarias de lunes a viernes pero los sábados y domingos atiende desde muy temprano y todo el día trabaja en su bodega, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajador y responsable y por eso Dios siempre está con él.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá comprar mas mercaderías (abarrotes) para su negocio y con ello tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer, con esta mejora el podrá brindarle a sus clientes nuevos productos y tendrá mayores ingresos, para si poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” comprarse un Auto y una guitarra”.
texts.en: Victor is a very hard-working 54-year-old who considers himself a young man of 20. He is married and has six children who are grown up. In his limited free time he enjoys planting and caring for his garden. Like many Peruvians, Victor loves food, and his favorite meal is a noodle dish called "Tallarines con Carapulcra." Victor only went to school through his junior year of high school because his parents didn't have much money, but he would really like to study auto mechanics. He not only has a convenience store that sells groceries and products of primary need, but also makes a living renting a motorcycle taxi to earn a little more income. Not only that, but he also works seasonally on a farm. Victory dedicates himself to his store for about seven hours a day Monday-Friday, but on Saturdays and Sundays he gets there very early and works the whole day. He believes his business is doing well because he is very hard-working and responsible, so God is always with him. Victor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to your help he will be able to purchase more groceries for his business so he can have a wider variety of products to offer. That will improve his store because he can provide his customers with a wider selection and increase his profits so he can fulfill his biggest dream: "to buy myself a car and a guitar."

loans.use: to purchase groceries for his store.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and four children who are still studying. Jamal's work is the main source of income for the family and he has big responsibilities. 

Jamal has been working as a van driver for the past eleven years. He works on a free-lance basis depending on his customers’ requests. Today he is asking to borrow $1,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his van. That way, he will secure his customers' safety. In the future, he plans to expand his business by buying a bigger van with more passengers’ seats.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his van.

loans.name: Krubo

texts.en: For the past years now, Krubo has been selling palm oil by the gallon in the market. Krubo is 49 years old, married and has five children between 11 and 30 years old. She lives in West Point. Krubo received a small amount from her husband to start her business. She learned it from her oldest sister. She likes her business because it helps her to feed her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en: Clovice used the previous loan to buy manure and pesticides for his farm so as to increase his production which can be evidenced by the fact that he now has a poultry project alongside farming. His challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, and customers not paying on time. His dream is to educate his children and buy land to grow crops.

loans.use: to buy chicks for rearing

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Above is a picture of Carol, a secondary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. Carol was born in Makeni city, thirty-six years ago. He is single with one child.  Carol has requested a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to pay college fees to pursue further studies. Carol will repay SMT/Kiva lenders each month, using his monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay college fees to pursue further studies

loans.name: Yosein Sander

texts.es: El socio continua con su trabajo de chofer de combi; el socio trabaja en su misma unidad vehicular y en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de llanatas nuevas para continuar operando en la misma ruta. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de llantas para su combi.
texts.en: This lending group member continues with his work as a minibus driver. He works in his own vehicle and right now he wants to invest a loan in the purchase of new tires for his minibus so that he can keep running his route.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Carmen has a food shop in the school canteen that makes & sells snacks like rice & pancakes & also fruit juices or orange juice. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.
Carmen is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Carmen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret used the previous loan to buy feeds and medicine for her poultry. However her challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and high costs of maintaining her poultry. Her dream is to develop her business into a model poultry project. Margret needs the loan to buy chicks for rearing.

loans.use: to purchase chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Farhang

texts.en:
Farhang is a 29-year-old divorced Iraqi man. He is living with his family of five, contributing to the family's income, and helping to support them. 

He has been running his own little business, a general store, since 2009 and in an effort to improve his little corner store, has applied for a small loan to renew and refurbish it, and to be able to purchase more stock of items to sell.

Farhang took a loan of 1,200 USD from Relief International - Iraq, and he hopes to generate a 10% growth in sales to better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell and refurbish the store

loans.name: María Mabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Patricio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Cuba en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar conocimos a María, tiene 22 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres, estudia Ing. En Marketing en la Universidad en Manta. Lleva 10 ciclos en el Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del grupo  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan ya que gracias a esto puede continuar en sus estudios.

Ella tiene un pequeño bazar en la casa de los padres en el cual vende de todo un poco como ropa, zapatos, tarjetas, peluches y cosas para regalos,  también realiza recargas telefónicas con lo cual se gana algo extra, en la actualidad está vendiendo ropa por catalogo lo cual lo realiza tanto en su local como en su centro de estudios ya que allá tiene varios clientes. Lleva más de 1 año con su negocio el cual comenzó con uno de los créditos que recibió del banco.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, tarjetas y otros productos que vende en su local.
  
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en: The San Patricio Community Bank meets every 15 days in the Cuba barrio in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches and being a place of unmatched beauty with many tourist attractions. It is here we find María, who is 22, single and lives with her parents. She studies engineering and marketing at the university in Manta. There have been 10 loan cycles with the community bank and she is the group's secretary. She enjoys being a part of it because of the help she gets; thanks to the loans she can continue her studies. María has a small convenience store in her parents home, selling a little bit of everything like clothes, shoes, phone cards, stuffed animals and gifts, as well as reloading phone cards, which earns a little extra. Currently she is selling clothing via catalog as much at her store as at the university, where she has a number of customers. She has more than one year of experience with the business, which she started with one of the loans the bank received. With this loan, she plans to purchase clothing, shoes, perfumes, phone cards and other products to sell in her store. Her dream is to finish her studies and become a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
Sarah Jane is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Sarah Jane has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Sarah Jane is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Sarah Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed used the previous loan to buy beans to sell. His challenges have been the seasonal weather, price fluctuations and inflation of agricultural products. His dream is to build a permanent home, educate his children and expand his business into new markets. Ahmed needs the loan to purchase maize for planting.

loans.use: to purchase maize for planting

loans.name: Salah

texts.en: Salah is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He’s the main income provider in his family and searching to enrich their life. He has been working as a plumber since 1979. He works independently, on a freelance basis. Today, he’s looking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new plumbing tools such as toilets and kitchen supplies. He’s in need of new projects and added numbers of clients in order to increase his profits. In the future, he plans to open his own plumbing equipment shop.

loans.use: to purchase new plumbing fixtures such as toilets and kitchen supplies

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a 46-year-old married man living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a poultry project, which he started 10 years ago. His challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and the high costs of chicken feed. His dream is to educate his children and transform his project into a big poultry farm in town. Benjamin needs the loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with five children. 

Erlinda has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands like pancit bihon & chicken & pork adobo. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en: Rogers is a 32-year-old married man living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a clinical officer and sole bread winner for his family. His challenge is the increasing prices making the cost of living high and delays in salary payments at his place of work. His dream is educating his children and self education. Rogers needs the loan to pay his school fees.

loans.use: to pay his school fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 35-year-old married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and two children who are still attending school. Even though his wife is working, he is the main source of income for the family. Mohammad decided to start his own business in 2009, so he opened a barber shop as well as a gym.  Today, he hopes to borrow $3000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy new barbers' tools and additional sports machines for the gym. This Kiva loan will allow him to attract more customers and therefore increase his revenues. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop his business.

loans.use: to buy new barbers' tools and additional sports machines for the gym.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza is 52 years old and married. She owns houses which she rents out for income. She has been in this business for seven years. She started as a farmer, then saved to construct her houses. 

Tereza faces the challenge of inadequate capital and delayed payment by the tenants. She hopes to expand her business to new markets and construct more houses. Tereza needs a loan to renovate her rental houses.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is 36 years old and a single father of one child of school-going age. He is a banker and has been doing this for seven years since he graduated from the university. He faces the challenge of high taxes. Despite this, Willy wants to educate his only child up to the university level.

Willy hopes to diversify into other businesses in the future and he intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his daughter and other dependants.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 30-year-old married man living in a company house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is an employee of a tea company where he works as an electrician, and he is the only breadwinner for his family. His challenge is price fluctuations and inflation. His dream is to educate his children and himself. Godfrey needs a loan to pay his school fees.

loans.use: to pay his school fees.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca has been in the cereals business in Nakuru town for the last 11 years.  She is 46 years old and married with two school-going children. Apart from the cereals business, which is her primary activity, she also has a venture in the clothes-selling business.

Francisca was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of cereals for sale in her business.

In the future, Francisca hopes to expand her business and supply cereals to other parts of Nakuru, as well as open a milling factory.

loans.use: To add more stock of assorted cereals for sale.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is 38 years old, a married father of eight children. He has a business selling new clothes which he has been doing for over ten years. He started as a fish monger and then diverted into the clothing business. He faces the challenges of high fuel and transport costs. His goal for his family is to educate his children. He wishes to expand his business into new markets. Godfrey needs this loan to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 28 años de edad,  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena  y se dedica a la producción de comidas rápidas, negocio que ha sido muy importante para lograr el bienestar de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y su hijo de 4 años de edad.  Su idea de negocio nació,  cuando dejó de ser empleado y buscando oportunidades de ingresos decidió aplicar su experiencia en la preparación de comidas rápidas;  así fue como emprendió su propia aventura de negocios, en una esquina de su calle, teniendo en cuenta que no existía competencia y había la necesidad de esa comunidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará un horno para elaborar pizzas, mesas y sillas plásticas,  para brindar comodidad a su clientela y diversificar con un nuevo producto. Su mayor desafío es lograr tener un local bien elegante, que llame la atención de sus clientes, por ser un ambiente confortable.  Su inversión será exitosa, porque la realizará en una época en la cual se incrementa el cosumo de alimentos en especial de comidas rápidas, porque hay mucho dinero circulante.
texts.en:
Santos, who is 28, lives in the city of Cartagena and makes fast food. This business has been very important for the well-being of his family, which is made up of his wife and his four-year-old son.

His idea for the business was born when he lost his job and, while looking for opportunities for income, he decided to use his experience in making fast food. That was how he embarked on his business adventure at a corner of his street where there was no competition and there was a need in the community.

Santos is currently applying for his first Kiva loan, which is also the first loan he's had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to buy a pizza oven, tables and plastic chairs to make his customers more comfortable and diversify with a new product. His greatest challenge is to have an elegant establishment that gets his customers' attention as being a comfortable area.
